intro: Tilioides, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plants are characterized by their small, yellowish flowers and spiny or thorny stems. They are often shrubs or small trees, with alternate, simple leaves. Tilioides species are adapted to arid environments and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
